meanings.definition: The scientific study of blood serum.
meanings.sent1: In serology, scientists analyze blood serum to learn more about it.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use serology to understand how blood serum works in the body.
meanings.sent3: The serology lab had a mix-up and accidentally studied saliva instead of blood serum.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with serology was like peering through a microscope into a mysterious world.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained serology in such a clear way that it was easy to remember.

meanings.definition: The diagnostic examination of blood serum.
meanings.sent1: The doctor ordered a serology test to check for any abnormalities in the blood serum.
meanings.sent2: Serology helps identify diseases by analyzing blood serum samples.
meanings.sent3: During the serology test, the technician accidentally spilled the blood serum sample.
meanings.sent4: The importance of serology in diagnosing illnesses cannot be overstated.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of the blood serum under the microscope during serology testing stayed with her.
